See also: gegen-

German[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From Middle High German gegen, from Old High German gagan, from Proto-Germanic *gagin. Cognate with Dutch tegen, English against, Icelandic gegn.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ˈɡe.ɡən/, [ˈɡeː.ɡn̩], [ˈɡeː.ɡŋ̍]
  • audio
    		(file)

Preposition[edit]

gegen (+ accusative)

  1. against
    Der Erklärung der Vereinten Nationen über die Beseitigung der Gewalt gegen Frauen.
    The United Nations Declaration on the Elimination of Violence against Women.

Usage notes[edit]

  • Like its Middle High German predecessor, gegen was formerly also used with the dative, especially by Upper German writers. Compare entgegen, which still takes dative.

Synonyms[edit]

  • wider

Middle High German[edit]

Alternative forms[edit]

  • gagen
  • jegen
  • gein, gēn (contractions)

Etymology[edit]

From Old High German gagan, Old High German gagen, Old High German gegin.

Preposition[edit]

gegen (+ dative, sometimes + accusative)

  1. against
